case_title: WAJID ALI vs ZAFAR KHALIL, ADVOCATE and another

accussed_details.name: Zafar Khalil
allegation: Failure to secure bail for complainant's son

accussed_details.name: Haji Gulzada Khan
allegation: Failure to secure bail for complainant's son

complaint_summary: Wajid Ali alleged that respondents demanded Rs. 77,000 to secure bail for his son Wahid Ali but failed to fulfill their commitment and returned only Rs. 8,000 initially, refusing to return the remaining amount until intervention by elders.
investigation_summary: The Disciplinary Committee initiated proceedings on 1998-07-25. Respondents admitted partial repayment but failed to rebut allegations. Case referred to Tribunal for final adjudication.
judgment_summary: Respondents found guilty of professional misconduct for extorting Rs. 77,000 from the complainant under false pretenses. Tribunal ordered suspension from practice for three years starting 1999-12-18 and imposed costs of Rs. 25,000 payable to N.-W.F.P. Bar Council.
punishment: Suspension from practice for three years starting 1999-12-18; Rs. 25,000 costs payable to N.-W.F.P. Bar Council.
Decision_or_verdict: Respondents guilty of professional misconduct; suspension and monetary penalty imposed.
legal_arguments: Misconduct under Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973 is not compoundable.
Advocates must maintain dignity and trust under Rules 134, 172, and 175-A of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976.
statutes: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973
Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976

witness_statement.Wajid Ali: Respondents threatened complainant to compromise; returned Rs. 27,000 under duress. Later returned full Rs. 77,000 through intervention of elders.

key_issues: Extortion of money under false pretenses

maxims.Legal Ethics: Advocates must uphold dignity and trust of the legal profession.

legal_terms.Professional Misconduct: Violation of ethical and professional standards by a legal practitioner.

words_and_phrases.Misconduct: Improper or unethical behavior by a professional.
words_and_phrases.Extortion: Obtaining money through coercion or threats.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves professional misconduct by advocates who extorted Rs. 77,000 from complainant under false pretenses. Tribunal imposed suspension and monetary penalty.

allegations: Respondents demanded Rs. 77,000 for securing bail for complainant's son.
Respondents failed to secure bail or return the full amount.
Complainant's son was falsely implicated in criminal cases.
facts.money_returned: Rs. 77,000 returned after intervention by elders.

actions_taken: Case referred to Tribunal for final adjudication.

complainant_statement.content: Respondents threatened complainant to compromise the case. Rs. 27,000 paid under duress; Rs. 50,000 still outstanding.

tribunal_findings.costs_imposed: Rs. 25,000 payable equally by respondents to N.-W.F.P. Bar Council

legal_references.act: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

legal_references.rules: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976

legal_references.case_reference: Muhammad Amin v. M. Asghar Khokhar, Advocate (1992 CLC 1596)
